maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving data on a specific client
Cmdlet which retrieves a PS Object with data on a specific client on a specific network
Network Id for the network which the client is associated with
Client Id of the client you want to retrieve data on

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Network Id for the network which the client is associated with
Client Id of the client you want to retrieve data on

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Id (network id) into the cmdlet
System.String[] - You can pipe the ClientId (Client Id) into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the specific client defined.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet will retrieve a PS Object on a specific client, defined by the -ClientId, on a specific Network defined by -Id

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retriving information on a specific Meraki device
Cmdlet which will retrieve a PS Object of information on a specific Meraki Device
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the specific device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve a PS Object of the device specified by the serial number provided in the parameter -Serial
This example will grap the serial through the pipeline and return an PS Object of the specified device.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all clientes associated to a specific device
This cmdlet will retrieve all the clients which are or have been connected to a specific device
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.Array - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the clients associated to a specific device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will return all the clients that are or have been connected, the last 24 hours, to a specific Cisco Meraki device.
This example will grap the serial fnumber from the pipeline and retrieve all the clients connected to the specific device.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all (meraki)devices on a network
Cmdlet which will retrieve a PS Object with an array of all the networks claimed and added to a specific network
Network Id from the network you want to retrive the devices from.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Network Id from the network you want to retrive the devices from.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Id(network id) into the cmdlet
System.Array[] - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the devices on the network.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrive all the networks located on the network with the "<network_id>" you provided the in the parameter Id.
This example will grap the id of the network with name "Network1" through the pipeline and return all the (network)devices on that specific network.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all networks in an Meraki Organisation.
This cmdlet will retrieve a powershell object with information on all the networks in your Meraki Organisation.
Organisation id of the specific organisation you want to see the devices from. If you have run Set-SCMrkAuth before running this cmdlet the parameter is not necessary.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
Organisation id of the specific organisation you want to see the devices from. If you have run Set-SCMrkAuth before running this cmdlet the parameter is not necessary.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe OrgId as a string into the cmdlet.
System.Array[] - The cmdlet will output an PS Object with an array of all the networks.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will take an ApiKey and an Organisation Id and retrieve all networks in that organisation.
If you have already run Set-SCMrkAuth, then you will not need to provide any other parameters for retriving networks in that organisation you specified in Set-MrkAuth.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retriving confiurations on a switch port
Cmdlet for retriving configurations on a specific Meraki Switch port.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.
The port id on the Meraki switch

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.
The port id on the Meraki switch

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.String[] - You can pipe the PortId into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the Switch port

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve the configurations on a specific Meraki switch port.
This example will grap the serial from the pipeline and retrieve the configuratoins on switch port 1

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retriving all Switch ports from a Meraki switch
Cmdlet which retrieves configuration data on all switch ports of a Meraki Switch.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.
The Serial number for a specific Cisco Meraki device.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the Serial into the cmdlet
System.Object[] - This cmdlet will output a PS Object with data on the specific device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve data from all ports on a Meraki Switch.
This example will grap the Meraki Switch Serial number and pipe it into the cmdlet, to retrieve data on all the Meraki switch ports.

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for connecting to Meraki Dashboard API.
Cmdlet whitch which will authenticate your API key with Meraki Dashboard The cmdlet is necessary for not having to provide the API Key for the follwing cmdlets you will use.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

Organisation Id for the specific Organisation you want to connect to. If you only have a single organisation, you can skip this parameter. If you have multiple Organisations but don't provide an organisation id the cmdlet will automatically connect you to the first organisation it retrieves.

ApiKey for Meraki Dashboard. Check following Meraki Docs to see how to get a Dashboard API Key: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API#:~:text=For%20access%20to%20the%20API,to%20generate%20an%20API%20key.

Organisation Id for the specific Organisation you want to connect to. If you only have a single organisation, you can skip this parameter. If you have multiple Organisations but don't provide an organisation id the cmdlet will automatically connect you to the first organisation it retrieves.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] - You can pipe the ApiKey as a string into the cmdlet
System.String[] - The cmdlet returns a string with successfull statement, if connection was successfull

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will connect to the Meraki Dashboard API. If you have multiple Organisations attached to your API key, the cmdlet will atumatically connect you to the firs Organisation.
This examplel will connect you to the Merakii Dashboard API, and to the specific organisation specified with the parameter OrgId
